summary.long: Deuteronomy is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: This is the speech Moses gave in the desert east of the Jordan River, on the plains, near Suph, between Paran and Tophel, and near Laban, Hazeroth, and Di Zahab. He spoke to all the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (It takes 11 days to go from Mount Horeb to Kadesh Barnea by way of Mount Seir.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the eleventh month in the fortieth year after they had left Egypt, Moses told the Israelites everything Yahweh had commanded him to tell them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was after he had defeated King Sihon of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon, and King Og of Bashan, who ruled in Ashtaroth and in Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Israelites were east of the Jordan River in Moab when Moses began to review God’s teachings.
This is what he said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At Mount Horeb Yahweh our Elohim said to us, “You have stayed at this mountain long enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Break camp, and get ready! Go to the mountain region of the Amorites, and go to everyone living on the plains, in the mountains, in the foothills, in the Negev, on the whole Mediterranean coast (the land of the Canaanites), and into Lebanon as far as the Euphrates River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m giving you this land. Enter, and take possession of the land Yahweh swore to give to your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and to you, their descendants.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time I said to you, “I’m not able to take care of you by myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim has made your population increase so that you are now as numerous as the stars in the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May Yahweh Elohim of your ancestors make you a thousand times more numerous, and may he bless you as he has promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can I take care of your problems, your troubles, and your disagreements all by myself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From each of your tribes, choose some men who are wise, intelligent, and experienced, and I’ll appoint them to be your leaders.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You agreed that this was a good idea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took the heads of your tribes who were wise and experienced men and made them officers for each of your tribes. I put them in charge of groups of 1,000, or 100, or 50, or 10 people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also at that time I gave these instructions to your judges: “Hear the cases that your people bring. Judge each case fairly, no matter whether it is a dispute between two Israelites or a dispute between an Israelite and a non-Israelite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be impartial in your decisions. Listen to the least important people the same way you listen to the most important people. Never be afraid of anyone, since your decisions come from Elohim. You may bring me any case that’s too hard for you, and I will hear it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I told you how to handle these situations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we left Mount Horeb, as Yahweh our Elohim had commanded. We traveled through all that vast and dangerous desert you saw on the way to the mountain region of the Amorites. At last we came to Kadesh Barnea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to you, “We have come to the mountain region of the Amorites, which Yahweh our Elohim is giving us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim is giving you this land. Go ahead! Take possession of it, as Yahweh Elohim of your ancestors told you. Don’t be afraid or terrified.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of you came to me and said, “Let’s send men ahead of us to gather information about the land for us. Have them report to us about the route we should take and the cities we’ll come to.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It seemed like a good idea to me. So I chose 12 of your men, one from each tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left and went into the mountains. When they came to the Eshcol Valley, they explored it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took some of the region’s fruit with them and brought it back to us. They reported, “The land that Yahweh our Elohim is giving us is good.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you rebelled against the command of Yahweh your Elohim and refused to go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You complained in your tents and said, “Yahweh hates us! That’s why he brought us out of Egypt. He wanted to hand us over to the Amorites so that they could destroy us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where are we going anyway? Our own men have discouraged us by saying, ‘The people there are taller and stronger than we are. The cities are big with sky-high walls! We even saw the people of Anak there.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to you, “Don’t tremble. Don’t be afraid of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim, who is going ahead of you, will fight for you as you saw him fight for you in Egypt
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the desert.” There you saw how Yahweh your Elohim carried you, as parents carry their children. He carried you wherever you went until you came to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In spite of this, you didn’t trust Yahweh your Elohim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who went ahead of you to find places for you to camp. He appeared in a column of fire at night and in a column of smoke during the day to show you which route to take.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yahweh heard what you said, he was angry and took this oath:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Not one of these evil people will ever see the good land that I swore to give to your ancestors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except Caleb, son of Jephunneh. He will see it, and I will give the land that he set his feet on to him and his descendants, because he wholeheartedly followed Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh became angry with me because of you. He said, “You won’t go there either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But your assistant Joshua, son of Nun, will go there. Encourage him, because he will help Israel take possession of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although you thought the little children would be captured in war, your children, who are still too young to know the difference between good and evil, will enter that land. I will give it to them, and they will take possession of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turn around, go back into the desert, and follow the road that goes to the Red Sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You responded, “We have sinned against Yahweh. We’ll go and fight, as Yahweh our Elohim commanded us to do.” Each of you armed yourself for war, thinking you could easily invade the mountain region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yahweh said to me, “Tell them, ‘Don’t go and fight, because I won’t be with you. You will be defeated by your enemies.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I told you, but you wouldn’t listen. You defied Yahweh’s command and invaded the mountain region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Amorites who lived there came out and attacked you and chased you like a swarm of bees. They defeated you, chasing you from Seir all the way to Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you came back, you cried to Yahweh, but Yahweh didn’t listen to you or hear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why you stayed in Kadesh as long as you did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We went back into the desert, following the road that goes to the Red Sea as Yahweh had told me. For a long time we traveled around the region of Mount Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You’ve traveled around this region long enough. Now go north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give the people these instructions: ‘You’re going to pass through the territory of your relatives, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir. They’ll be afraid of you, but be very careful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t start a fight with them, because I’m not giving you any of their land—not even enough to stand on. I’ve given Esau’s descendants the region of Mount Seir as their property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must pay them in silver for the food you eat and the water you drink.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim has blessed you in everything you have done. He has watched over you as you traveled through this vast desert. For 40 years now Yahweh your Elohim has been with you, and you haven’t needed a thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we passed by our relatives, the descendants of Esau, who lived in Seir. We turned off the road that goes through the plains to Elath and Ezion Geber and took the road that goes through the desert of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me, “Don’t bother the people of Moab or start a war with them. I’m not giving you any of Ar as your property. I have given it to the descendants of Lot.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Emites used to live there. These people were as strong, as numerous, and as tall as the people of Anak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were thought to be Rephaim, like the people of Anak, but the Moabites called them Emites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Horites used to live in Seir, but the descendants of Esau claimed their land, wiped them out, and took their place, as Israel did in the land that Yahweh gave them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord said, “Now cross the Zered River.”
So we crossed the Zered River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thirty-eight years passed from the time we left Kadesh Barnea until we crossed the Zered River. During that time all our soldiers from that generation died, as Yahweh had sworn they would.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, it was Yahweh himself who got rid of all of them until none were left in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the last of these soldiers had died,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Today you are going to pass by the border of Moab at Ar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you come near the Ammonites, don’t bother them or start a fight with them. I’m not giving you any of the land that I have already given to the descendants of Lot as their property.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This land was thought of as the land of the Rephaim who used to live there, but the Ammonites called them Zamzummim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These people were as strong, as numerous, and as tall as the people of Anak. But Yahweh wiped them out before the Ammonites came so that the Ammonites claimed their land and took their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh did the same thing for the descendants of Esau, who lived in Seir. Before the descendants of Esau came, he wiped out the Horites so that Esau’s descendants claimed their land and took their place. Esau’s descendants are still there today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same thing happened to the Avvites who lived in villages as far away as Gaza. The Caphtorites, who came from Crete, wiped them out and took their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord continued, “Now break camp. Cross the Arnon Valley. I’m going to hand King Sihon of Heshbon, the Amorite, over to you. Fight him, and take possession of his country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today I will start to make all the people under heaven terrified of you. When they hear about you, they will tremble and shake because of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the desert of Kedemoth, I sent messengers to King Sihon of Heshbon with the following offer of peace:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you allow us to travel through your country, we’ll go straight through and won’t ever leave the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We’ll pay you in silver for the food we eat and the water we drink. Please let us go through,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, and the Moabites, who live in Ar, did for us. We’ll keep going until we cross the Jordan River into the land Yahweh our Elohim is giving us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But King Sihon of Heshbon wouldn’t allow us to pass through. Yahweh your Elohim made him stubborn and overconfident in order to hand him over to you, as he has now done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me, “I have begun to give you Sihon and his country. Go ahead! Take possession of his land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sihon and all his troops came out to meet us in battle at Jahaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh our Elohim gave Sihon to us, and we defeated him, his sons, and all his troops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time we captured all his cities and claimed them for God by destroying men, women, and children. There were no survivors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, we did loot the cities that we captured, taking the cattle and goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Aroer on the edge of the Arnon Valley and the city in that valley as far as Gilead, no city had walls that could keep us out. Yahweh our Elohim gave us all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yahweh our Elohim had forbidden you to go anywhere near the land of the Ammonites. So you didn’t enter the land along the bank of the Jabbok River or capture the cities in the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next we turned and followed the road that goes to Bashan. King Og of Bashan and all his troops came to fight us at Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me, “Don’t be afraid of him. I’ll hand him, all his troops, and his land over to you. Do to him what you did to King Sihon of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Yahweh our Elohim also handed King Og of Bashan and all his troops over to us. We defeated him, leaving no survivors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time we captured all of his cities. There wasn’t a city we didn’t take. We captured a total of 60 cities—the whole territory of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of these cities were fortified with high walls and double-door gates with bars across the gates. We also captured a large number of unwalled villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We claimed them all for God, destroying every city, including men, women, and children—as we did to King Sihon of Heshbon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, we did loot the cities, taking all of the cattle and goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We took the land of the two Amorite kings east of the Jordan River, from the Arnon Valley to Mount Hermon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The Sidonians call Mount Hermon by the name Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We took all of the cities of the plateau, all of Gilead, and all of Bashan as far as Salcah and Edrei, cities of Og’s kingdom in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Of the Rephaim only King Og of Bashan was left. His bed was made of iron and was more than 13 feet long and 6 feet wide. It is still in the Ammonite city of Rabbah.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time we took possession of this land. I gave the tribes of Reuben and Gad the land north of Aroer near the Arnon Valley and half of the mountain region of Gilead with its cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave the rest of Gilead and all of Bashan ruled by Og to half of the tribe of Manasseh. (The whole territory of Argob in Bashan used to be called the land of the Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jair, a descendant of Manasseh, took the whole territory of Argob as far as the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites. The settlements in Bashan he named Havvoth Jair after himself. This is still their name today.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave Gilead to Machir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave the tribes of Reuben and Gad some of Gilead from the Arnon Valley (the middle of the valley is the border) to the Jabbok River, which is the border of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their land included the plains around the Jordan River. The western border was the river, from the Sea of Galilee to the Sea of the Plains (the Dead Sea), which is near Mount Pisgah on the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave the tribes of Reuben and Gad and half of the tribe of Manasseh this command: “Yahweh your Elohim has given you this land so that you can take possession of it. All your soldiers must be ready for battle when they cross the Jordan River ahead of the other Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know you have a lot of livestock. Your wives, children, and livestock must stay here in the cities that I gave you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your soldiers will go with the other Israelites until they take possession of the land Yahweh your Elohim is giving them on the other side of the Jordan River. Then they will have a place to rest as you have. After that each of you may go back to the land I gave you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also gave Joshua this command: “You have seen with your own eyes everything that Yahweh your Elohim has done to these two kings. Yahweh will do the same to all of the kingdoms on the other side of the Jordan River where you’re going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t be afraid of them, because Yahweh your Elohim himself will fight for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I pleaded with Yahweh:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Adonay Yahweh, you have only begun to show me how great and powerful you are. What kind of god is there in heaven or on earth who can do the deeds and the mighty acts you have done?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please let me go over and see the beautiful land on the other side of the Jordan River—those beautiful mountains in Lebanon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh was angry with me because of you, so he wouldn’t listen to me. Yahweh said, “That’s enough out of you! Don’t talk to me anymore about this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go to the top of Mount Pisgah, and look west, north, south, and east. You may look at the land, but you will never cross the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give instructions to Joshua. Encourage and strengthen him, because he will lead these people across the Jordan River, and he will help them take possession of the land you see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we stayed in the valley near Beth Peor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel, listen to the laws and rules I am about to teach you. Obey them so that you will live and be able to enter and take possession of the land that Yahweh Elohim of your ancestors is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never add anything to what I command you, or take anything away from it. Then you will be able to obey the commands of Yahweh your Elohim that I give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With your own eyes you saw what Yahweh did at Baal Peor. Yahweh your Elohim destroyed everyone among you who worshiped the god Baal while you were at Peor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you were loyal to Yahweh your Elohim and are still alive today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have taught you laws and rules as Yahweh my Elohim commanded me. You must obey them when you’ve entered the land and taken possession of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Faithfully obey these laws. This will show the people of the world your wisdom and insight. When they hear about all these laws, they will say, “What wise and insightful people there are in this great nation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What great nation ever had their gods as near to them as Yahweh our Elohim is near to us whenever we pray to him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what other great nation has such fair laws and rules as all these teachings I am giving you today?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, be careful, and watch yourselves closely so that you don’t forget the things which you have seen with your own eyes. Don’t let them fade from your memory as long as you live. Teach them to your children and grandchildren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never forget the day you stood in front of Yahweh your Elohim at Mount Horeb. Yahweh had said to me, “Assemble the people in front of me, and I will let them hear my words. Then they will learn to fear me as long as they live on earth, and they will teach their children the same thing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you came and stood at the foot of the mountain, which was on fire with flames shooting into the sky. It was dark, cloudy, and gloomy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to you from the fire. You heard a voice speaking but saw no one. There was only a voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh told you about the terms of his promise, the ten commandments, which he commanded you to do. Then he wrote them on two stone tablets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh also commanded me to teach you the laws and rules you must obey after you cross the Jordan River and take possession of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You didn’t see Yahweh the day he spoke to you from the fire at Mount Horeb. So be very careful
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you don’t become corrupt and make your own carved idols. Don’t make statues that represent men or women,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: any animal on earth, any creature with wings that flies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: any creature that crawls on the ground, or any fish in the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t let yourselves be tempted to worship and serve what you see in the sky—the sun, the moon, the stars, or anything else. Yahweh your Elohim has given them to all people everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are the people Yahweh brought out of Egypt, the iron smelter, in order to make you his own people as you still are today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh was angry with me because of you. So Yahweh your Elohim took an oath that I wouldn’t cross the Jordan River and enter the good land he is giving you as your property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m going to die in this land and not cross the Jordan River, but you’re going to go across and take possession of that good land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful that you don’t forget the promise that Yahweh your Elohim made to you. Don’t make your own carved idols or statues that represent anything Yahweh your Elohim has forbidden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim is Esh Oklah, El Kanna.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even when you have children and grandchildren and have grown old in that land, don’t become corrupt and make carved idols or statues that represent anything. I call heaven and earth as witnesses against you today: If you do this thing that Yahweh your Elohim considers evil, making him furious,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you will quickly disappear from the land you’re going to possess on the other side of the Jordan River. You won’t live very long there. You’ll be completely wiped out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh will scatter you among the people of the world, and only a few of you will be left among the nations where Yahweh will force you to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There you will worship wooden and stone gods made by human hands. These gods can’t see, hear, eat, or smell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you look for Yahweh your Elohim when you are among those nations, you will find him whenever you search for him with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you’re in distress and all these things happen to you, then you will finally come back to Yahweh your Elohim and obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim is a merciful God. He will not abandon you, destroy you, or forget the promise to your ancestors that he swore he would keep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Search the distant past, long before your time. Start from the very day Elohim created people on earth. Search from one end of heaven to the other. Has anything as great as this ever happened before, or has anything like it ever been heard of?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have any other people ever heard Elohim speak from a fire and lived? You did!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or has any god ever tried to come and take one nation away from another for himself? Yahweh your Elohim used his mighty hand and powerful arm to do this for you in Egypt. He did this using plagues, miraculous signs, amazing things, and war. He did his great and awe-inspiring deeds in front of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You were shown these things so that you would know that Yahweh is Elohim. There is no other god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He let you hear his voice from heaven so that he could instruct you. He showed you his great fire on earth, and you heard him speak from the column of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he loved your ancestors and chose their descendants, he was with you as he brought you out of Egypt by his great power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He forced nations greater and stronger than you out of your way to bring you into their land and give it to you. This land is your own possession today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember today, and never forget that Yahweh is Elohim in heaven above and here on earth. There is no other god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obey his laws and commands which I’m giving you today. Then things will go well for you and your descendants. You will live for a long time in the land. Yahweh your Elohim is giving you the land for as long as you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses set aside three cities on the east side of the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who unintentionally killed someone whom they had never hated could flee to one of these cities and save their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities were Bezer on the desert plateau for the tribe of Reuben, Ramoth in Gilead for the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan for the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Moses taught the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the commandments, laws, and rules Moses gave the Israelites after they had left Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave these to the people when they were east of the Jordan River in the valley near Beth Peor, in the land of King Sihon of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon. Moses and Israel defeated him after they left Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took possession of his land and the land of King Og of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites who were east of the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This land went from Aroer on the edge of the Arnon Valley to Mount Siyon (that is, Mount Hermon).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It included all the plains on the east side of the Jordan River as far as the Dead Sea at the foot of the slopes of Mount Pisgah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses summoned all Israel and said to them: Israel, listen to the laws and rules I’m telling you today. Learn them and faithfully obey them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh our Elohim made a promise to us at Mount Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh didn’t make this promise to our ancestors, but to all of us who are alive here today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to you face to face from the fire on the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I stood between Yahweh and you to tell you the word of Yahweh, because you were afraid of the fire and didn’t go up on the mountain. The Lord said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am Yahweh your Elohim, who brought you out of slavery in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Never have any other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never make your own carved idols or statues that represent any creature in the sky, on the earth, or in the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never worship them or serve them, because I, Yahweh your Elohim, am El Kanna. I punish children for their parents’ sins to the third and fourth generation of those who hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I show mercy to thousands of generations of those who love me and obey my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Never use the name of Yahweh your Elohim carelessly. Yahweh will make sure that anyone who uses his name carelessly will be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Observe the day of worship as a holy day. This is what Yahweh your Elohim has commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have six days to do all your work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh day is the day of worship dedicated to Yahweh your Elohim. You, your sons, your daughters, your male and female slaves, your oxen, your donkeys—all of your animals—even the foreigners living in your city must never do any work on that day. In this way your male and female slaves can rest as you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt and that Yahweh your Elohim used his mighty hand and powerful arm to bring you out of there. This is why Yahweh your Elohim has commanded you to observe the day of worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Honor your father and your mother as Yahweh your Elohim has commanded you. Then you will live for a long time, and things will go well for you in the land Yahweh your Elohim is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Never murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Never commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Never steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Never avoid the truth when you testify about your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Never desire to take your neighbor’s wife away from him.
“Never long for your neighbor’s household, his field, his male or female slave, his ox, his donkey, or anything else that belongs to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the commandments Yahweh spoke to your whole assembly on the mountain. He spoke in a loud voice from the fire, the cloud, and the gloomy darkness. Then he stopped speaking. He wrote the commandments on two stone tablets and gave them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you heard the voice coming from the darkness and saw the mountain blazing with fire, all the leaders and heads of your tribes came to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You said, “Yahweh our Elohim has let us see how great and glorious he is. We’ve heard his voice come from the fire. Today we’ve seen that people can live even if Elohim speaks to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should we die? This great fire will consume us! If we continue to hear the voice of Yahweh our Elohim, we’ll die!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who has ever heard the voice of Elohim Chay speak from a fire, as we did, and lived?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses, go and listen to everything that Yahweh our Elohim says. Then tell us whatever Yahweh our Elohim tells you. We’ll listen and obey.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yahweh heard the words that you spoke to me, Yahweh said, “I have heard what these people said to you. Everything they said was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only they would fear me and obey all my commandments as long as they live! Then things would go well for them and their children forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the people to go back to their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you stay here with me. I will give you all the commands, laws, and rules that you must teach them to obey in the land which I’m giving them to possess.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So be careful to do what Yahweh your Elohim has commanded you. Never stop living this way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Follow all the directions Yahweh your Elohim has given you. Then you will continue to live, life will go well for you, and you will live for a long time in the land that you are going to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the commands, laws, and rules Yahweh your Elohim commanded me to teach you. Obey them after you enter the land and take possession of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as you live, you, your children, and your grandchildren must fear Yahweh your Elohim. All of you must obey all his laws and commands that I’m giving you, and you will live a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, Israel, and be careful to obey these laws. Then things will go well for you and your population will increase in a land flowing with milk and honey, as Yahweh Elohim of your ancestors promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, Israel: Yahweh is our Elohim. Yahweh is the only God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love Yahweh your Elohim with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take to heart these words that I give you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Repeat them to your children. Talk about them when you’re at home or away, when you lie down or get up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Write them down, and tie them around your wrist, and wear them as headbands as a reminder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Write them on the doorframes of your houses and on your gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim will bring you into the land and give it to you, as he swore to your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. This land will have large, prosperous cities that you didn’t build.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your houses will be filled with all kinds of things that you didn’t put there. You will have cisterns that you didn’t dig and vineyards and olive trees that you didn’t plant. After you have eaten all that you want,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: be careful that you don’t forget Yahweh, who brought you out of slavery in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must fear Yahweh your Elohim, serve him, and take your oaths only in his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never worship any of the gods worshiped by the people around you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do, Yahweh your Elohim will become very angry with you and will wipe you off the face of the earth, because Yahweh your Elohim, who is with you, is El Kanna.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never test Yahweh your Elohim as you did at Massah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sure to obey the commands of Yahweh your Elohim and the regulations and laws he has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do what Yahweh considers right and good. Then things will go well for you, and you will enter and take possession of that good land which Yahweh promised to your ancestors with an oath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will see Yahweh expel your enemies as he said he would.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the future your children will ask you, “What do these regulations, laws, and rules which Yahweh our Elohim commanded you mean to you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them, “We were Pharaoh’s slaves in Egypt, but Yahweh used his mighty hand to bring us out of there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Right before our eyes Yahweh did miraculous signs and amazing things that were spectacular but terrible for Egypt, Pharaoh, and his whole family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh led us out of there to bring us here and give us this land he promised to our ancestors with an oath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh our Elohim commanded us to obey all these laws and to fear Yahweh. These laws are for our own good as long as we live so that he will preserve our lives. It’s still true today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how we’ll have the Lord’s approval: If we faithfully obey all these laws in the presence of Yahweh our Elohim, as he has commanded us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim will bring you to the land you’re about to enter and take possession of. He will force many nations out of your way: the Hittites, Girgashites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites—seven nations larger and more powerful than you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yahweh your Elohim gives them to you and you defeat them, destroy every one of them because they have been claimed by the Lord. Don’t make any treaties with them or show them any mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never marry any of them. Never let your daughters marry their sons or your sons marry their daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These people will turn your children away from me to worship other gods. Then Yahweh will get very angry with you and will quickly destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is what you must do to these people: Tear down their altars, smash their sacred stones, cut down their poles dedicated to the goddess Asherah, and burn their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are a holy people, who belong to Yahweh your Elohim. Yahweh your Elohim chose you to be his own special possession out of all the nations on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh set his heart on you and chose you, even though you didn’t outnumber all the other people. You were the smallest of all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You were chosen because Yahweh loved you and kept the oath he swore to your ancestors. So Yahweh used his mighty hand to bring you out. He freed you from slavery under Pharaoh (the king of Egypt).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep in mind that Yahweh your Elohim is the only Elohim. He is a faithful El, who keeps his promise and is merciful to thousands of generations of those who love him and obey his commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he sends destruction to pay back everyone who hates him. He never takes long to pay back anyone who hates him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So obey the commands, laws, and rules I’m giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you listen to these rules and faithfully obey them, Yahweh your Elohim will keep his promise to you and be merciful to you, as he swore to your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will love you, bless you, and increase the number of your descendants. He will bless you with children. He will bless your land with produce: grain, new wine, and olive oil. He will bless your herds with calves, and your flocks with lambs and kids. This will all happen in the land Yahweh will give you, as he swore to your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be blessed more than any other people. Your men and women will be able to have children, and your animals will be able to have offspring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh will keep you from having any kind of illness. He will not strike you with any of the terrible diseases you experienced in Egypt. Instead, he will strike all those who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must destroy all the people Yahweh your Elohim hands over to you. Have no pity on them, and never worship their gods, because they will be a trap for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may say to yourselves, “These nations outnumber us. How can we force them out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t be afraid of them. Remember what Yahweh your Elohim did to Pharaoh and all of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You saw with your own eyes the terrible plagues, the miraculous signs, and the amazing things Yahweh your Elohim did. He used his mighty hand and powerful arm to bring you out. Yahweh your Elohim will do the same thing to all the people you’re afraid of.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim will spread panic among them until they all die. There will be no one left—not even those who were hiding from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t be afraid of them, because Yahweh your Elohim is with you. He is a great and awe-inspiring El.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little by little Yahweh your Elohim will force these nations out of your way. You won’t be able to wipe them out quickly. Otherwise, you would be overrun with wild animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim will hand these people over to you and will throw them into a great panic until they’re destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will hand their kings over to you, and no one on earth will even remember their names. No one will be able to stop you. You will destroy them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Burn their idols. Don’t ever long for the silver and gold on these idols or take any of it for yourselves. It might be a trap for you. Besides, these idols are disgusting to Yahweh your Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never bring a disgusting idol into your house. If you do, you and the idol will be destroyed. Consider it detestable and disgusting. It must be destroyed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful to obey every command I give you today. Then you will live, and your population will increase. You will enter and take possession of the land that Yahweh promised to your ancestors with an oath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that for 40 years Yahweh your Elohim led you on your journey in the desert. He did this in order to humble you and test you. He wanted to know whether or not you would wholeheartedly obey his commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he made you suffer from hunger and then fed you with manna, which neither you nor your ancestors had seen before. He did this to teach you that a person cannot live on bread alone but on every word that Yahweh speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your clothes didn’t wear out, and your feet didn’t swell these past 40 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Learn this lesson by heart: Yahweh your Elohim was disciplining you as parents discipline their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obey the commands of Yahweh your Elohim. Follow his directions, and fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim is bringing you into a good land. It is a land with rivers that don’t dry up. There are springs and underground streams flowing through the valleys and hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land has wheat and barley, grapevines, fig trees, and pomegranates. The land has honey and olive trees for olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land will have enough food for you, and you will have everything you need. The land has rocks with iron ore, and you will be able to mine copper ore in the hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have eaten all you want, thank Yahweh your Elohim for the good land he has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful that you don’t forget Yahweh your Elohim. Don’t fail to obey his commands, rules, and laws that I’m giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat all you want. You will build nice houses and live in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your herds and flocks, silver and gold, and everything else you have will increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When this happens, be careful that you don’t become arrogant and forget Yahweh your Elohim, who brought you out of slavery in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was the one who led you through that vast and dangerous desert—a thirsty and arid land, with poisonous snakes and scorpions. He was the one who made water come out of solid rock for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was the one who fed you in the desert with manna, which your ancestors had never seen. He did this in order to humble you and test you. But he also did this so that things would go well for you in the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may say to yourselves, “I became wealthy because of my own ability and strength.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But remember Yahweh your Elohim is the one who makes you wealthy. He’s confirming the promise which he swore to your ancestors. It’s still in effect today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I warn you today that if you forget Yahweh your Elohim and follow other gods, and if you serve them and bow down to them, you will certainly be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh is going to destroy other nations as you enter the land. You will be destroyed like them if you don’t obey Yahweh your Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, Israel, you’re about to cross the Jordan River. You’ll be forcing out nations that are larger and stronger than you, with big cities that have sky-high walls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their people are tall and strong. They’re descendants of Anak. You know all about them. You’ve also heard it said, “Who can oppose the descendants of Anak?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Realize today that Yahweh your Elohim is the one who is going ahead of you like Esh Oklah. He will wipe them out and will use you to crush their power. You will take possession of their land and will quickly destroy them as Yahweh promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yahweh your Elohim expels these people in front of you, don’t say to yourselves, “Because we’ve been living right, Yahweh brought us here to take possession of this land.” No, it’s because these nations are so wicked that Yahweh is forcing them out of your way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s not because you’ve been living right or because you’re so honest that you’re entering to take possession of their land. It’s because these people are so wicked that Yahweh your Elohim is forcing them out of your way. It’s also because Yahweh wants to confirm the promise he swore to your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So understand this: It’s not because you’ve been living right that Yahweh your Elohim is giving you this good land to possess. You are impossible to deal with!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never forget how you made Yahweh your Elohim angry in the desert. You’ve rebelled against Yahweh from the day you left Egypt until you came here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even at Mount Horeb you made Yahweh so angry that Yahweh wanted to destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I went up on the mountain to get the stone tablets, the tablets of the promise that Yahweh made to you, I stayed on the mountain 40 days and 40 nights without food or water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh gave me the two stone tablets inscribed by Elohim himself. On them were written all the words that Yahweh spoke to you from the fire on the mountain on the day of the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of the 40 days and 40 nights, Yahweh gave me the two stone tablets with his promise on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh told me, “Leave right away. Your people whom you brought out of Egypt have ruined everything. They’ve quickly turned from the way I commanded them to live. They’ve made an idol for themselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh also said to me, “I’ve seen these people, and they are impossible to deal with.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leave me alone! I’ll destroy them and wipe their name off the earth. Then I’ll make you into a nation larger and stronger than they are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I turned and went down the mountain while it was still burning with fire. I was carrying the two tablets with the promise on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw that you had sinned against Yahweh your Elohim. You had made a statue of a calf for yourselves. You had quickly turned from the way Yahweh commanded you to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I took the two tablets, threw them down, and smashed them in front of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once again I threw myself down in front of Yahweh. I went without food and water for 40 days and 40 nights because of the sin you committed. You did what Yahweh considered evil and made him furious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was terrified of Yahweh’s anger and fury. He was so angry he wanted to destroy you. But once more Yahweh listened to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh also became very angry with Aaron and wanted to destroy him. But at that time I prayed for Aaron, too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I took that sinful calf you made and burned it. I crushed it, grinding it thoroughly until it was as fine as powder. Then I threw the powder into the river that flowed down the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also made Yahweh angry at Taberah, Massah, and Kibroth Hattaavah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yahweh sent you from Kadesh Barnea, he said, “Go and take possession of the land I’m giving you.” But you rebelled against the word of Yahweh your Elohim. You didn’t believe him or obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You’ve rebelled against Yahweh as long as I’ve known you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I threw myself down in front of Yahweh for 40 days and 40 nights because Yahweh said he would destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I prayed to Yahweh and said, “Adonay Yahweh, don’t destroy your people. They belong to you. You saved them by your great power and used your mighty hand to bring them out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Disregard the stubbornness, wickedness, and sin of these people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, the country we left will say, “Yahweh wasn’t able to bring them to the land he promised them. He hated them. That’s why he brought them out—to let them die in the desert.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are your people. They belong to you. You used your great strength and powerful arm to bring them out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Yahweh said to me, “Cut two more stone tablets like the first ones, and come up to me on the mountain. Also make an ark out of wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will write on the tablets the same words that were on the first tablets, which you smashed. Then you will put them in the ark.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I made an ark out of acacia wood. I cut two more stone tablets like the first ones. I carried the two tablets up the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh wrote on these tablets the same words as before, the ten commandments. He had spoken these words to you from the fire on the mountain on the day of the assembly. Then Yahweh gave them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I came back down the mountain and put the tablets in the ark I had made. They are still there, where Yahweh commanded me to put them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites moved from the wells of the Jaakanites to Moserah. Aaron died there and was buried, and his son Eleazar succeeded him as priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They moved from there to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land with rivers that don’t dry up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Yahweh set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of Yahweh’s promise, to stand in Yahweh’s presence when they serve him as priests, and to praise his name, as they still do today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is why the tribe of Levi has no land of their own as the other tribes have. Yahweh your Elohim is their only possession, as he promised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I stayed on the mountain 40 days and 40 nights as I did the first time. Once again Yahweh listened to me and Yahweh agreed not to destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me, “Lead the people on their journey. They will enter and take possession of the land I will give them, as I swore to their ancestors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel, what does Yahweh your Elohim want you to do? Yahweh your Elohim wants you to fear him, follow all his directions, love him, and worship Yahweh your Elohim with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh wants you to obey his commands and laws that I’m giving you today for your own good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that the sky, the highest heaven, the earth and everything it contains belong to Yahweh your Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh set his heart on your ancestors and loved them. Because of this, today he chooses you, their descendants, out of all the people of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So circumcise your uncircumcised hearts, and don’t be impossible to deal with any longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no one like Yahweh—your one true Elohim and Adonay. He is the great, powerful, and awe-inspiring El. He never plays favorites and never takes a bribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He makes sure orphans and widows receive justice. He loves foreigners and gives them food and clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you should love foreigners, because you were foreigners living in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear Yahweh your Elohim, worship him, be loyal to him, and take your oaths in his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is your glory. He is your Elohim, who did for you these spectacular and awe-inspiring deeds you saw with your own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When your ancestors went to Egypt, there were 70 of them. Now Yahweh your Elohim has made you as numerous as the stars in the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love Yahweh your Elohim, and do what he wants you to do. Always obey his laws, rules, and commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember today the discipline you learned from Yahweh your Elohim. (I’m not talking to your children. They didn’t see or experience any of this.) You saw and experienced his great power—his mighty hand and powerful arm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You saw the miraculous signs and deeds he did in Egypt to Pharaoh (the king of Egypt) and to his whole country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You saw what he did to the Egyptian army, its horses and chariots. He drowned them in the Red Sea when they pursued you. So Yahweh destroyed them forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You saw what he did for you in the desert until you came here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also saw what he did to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, from the tribe of Reuben. In the middle of all the Israelites the ground opened up and swallowed them, their families, their tents, and every living creature with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You saw with your own eyes all these spectacular things that Yahweh did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obey all the commands I’m giving you today. Then you will have the strength to enter and take possession of the land once you’ve crossed the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will also live for a long time in the land the Lord swore to give your ancestors and their descendants—a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land you’re about to enter and take possession of isn’t like the land you left in Egypt. There you used to plant your seed, and you had to water it like a vegetable garden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land you’re about to enter is a land with hills and valleys, watered by rain from the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a land Yahweh your Elohim cares about. Yahweh your Elohim watches over it all year long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you faithfully obey the commands that I’m giving you today, love Yahweh your Elohim, and serve him with all your heart and with all your soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send rain on your land at the right time, both in the fall and in the spring. Then you will gather your own grain, new wine, and olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will provide grass in the fields for your animals, and you will be able to eat all you want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful, or you’ll be tempted to turn away and worship other gods and bow down to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh will become angry with you. He’ll shut the sky so that there’ll be no rain. Then the ground won’t grow any crops, and you’ll quickly disappear from this good land Yahweh is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take these words of mine to heart and keep them in mind. Write them down, tie them around your wrist, and wear them as headbands as a reminder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach them to your children, and talk about them when you’re at home or away, when you lie down or get up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Write them on the doorframes of your houses and on your gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you and your children will live for a long time in this land that Yahweh swore to give to your ancestors—as long as there’s a sky above the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Faithfully obey all these commands I’m giving you. Love Yahweh your Elohim, follow all his directions, and be loyal to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh will force all these people out of your way. Then you will take possession of the land belonging to people taller and stronger than you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give you every place on which you set foot. Your borders will be from the desert to Lebanon, from the Euphrates River to the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one will be able to stop you. As Yahweh your Elohim promised, he will make people terrified of you wherever you go in this land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today I’m giving you the choice of a blessing or a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You’ll be blessed if you obey the commands of Yahweh your Elohim that I’m giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You’ll be cursed if you disobey the commands of Yahweh your Elohim, if you turn from the way I’m commanding you to live today, and if you worship other gods you never knew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yahweh your Elohim brings you into the land you’re about to enter, recite the blessing from Mount Gerizim and the curse from Mount Ebal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (These mountains are on the west side of the Jordan, beyond the road that goes west, in the region of the Canaanites who live on the plains facing Gilgal, next to the oak trees of Moreh.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You’re about to cross the Jordan River to enter and take possession of the land Yahweh your Elohim is giving you. When you take possession of it and live there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: be careful to obey all the laws and rules I’m giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here are the laws and rules you must faithfully obey in the land that Yahweh Elohim of your ancestors is giving you as your own. You must obey them as long as you live in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Completely destroy all the worship sites on the high mountains, on the hills, and under every large tree. The people you’re forcing out worship their gods in these places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tear down their altars, crush their sacred stones, burn their poles dedicated to the goddess Asherah, cut down their idols, and wipe out the names of their gods from those places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never worship Yahweh your Elohim in the way they worship their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim will choose a place out of all your tribes to live and put his name. Go there and worship him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring him your burnt offerings, your sacrifices, one-tenth of your income, your contributions, the offerings you vow to bring, your freewill offerings, and the firstborn of your cattle, sheep, and goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There, in the presence of Yahweh your Elohim, you and your families will eat and enjoy everything you’ve worked for, because Yahweh your Elohim has blessed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never worship in the way that it’s being done here today, where everyone does whatever he considers right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Up until now you haven’t come to your place of rest, the property Yahweh your Elohim is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you will cross the Jordan River and settle in the land Yahweh your Elohim is giving you as your own property. He will give you peace from all your enemies around you so that you will live securely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh your Elohim will choose a place where his name will live. You must bring everything I command you to that place. Bring your burnt offerings, your sacrifices, one-tenth of your income, your contributions, and all the best offerings you vow to bring to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enjoy yourselves in the presence of Yahweh your Elohim along with your sons, daughters, male and female slaves, and the Levites. (The Levites live in your cities because they have no land of their own as you have.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful that you don’t sacrifice your burnt offerings wherever you want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, sacrifice them only at the place that Yahweh will choose in one of your tribes. There you must do everything I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In whatever city you live, you may slaughter and eat as much meat as you want from what Yahweh your Elohim has blessed you with. Clean and unclean people may eat it as if they were eating a gazelle or a deer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But never eat the blood. Pour it on the ground like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may not eat the Lord’s offerings in your cities. Those offerings are: one-tenth of your grain, new wine, and olive oil; the firstborn of your cattle, sheep, or goats; the offerings you vow to bring; your freewill offerings; and your contributions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, you, your sons and daughters, male and female slaves, and the Levites who live in your cities must eat these in the presence of Yahweh your Elohim at the place Yahweh your Elohim will choose. There in the presence of Yahweh your Elohim enjoy everything you’ve worked for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t forget to take care of the Levites as long as you live in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim will expand your country’s borders as he promised. You will say, “I’m hungry for meat.” Then eat as much meat as you want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the place Yahweh your Elohim chooses to put his name is too far away from you, you may slaughter an animal from the herds or flocks that Yahweh has given you. Eat as much as you want in your city. I have commanded you to do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eat it as you would eat a gazelle or a deer: Clean and unclean people may eat it together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, be sure you never eat blood, because blood contains life. Never eat the life with the meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never eat blood. Pour it on the ground like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you don’t eat blood, things will go well for you and your descendants. You will be doing what Yahweh considers right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the holy things and the offerings you have vowed to bring, and go to the place Yahweh will choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sacrifice the meat and the blood of your burnt offerings on the altar of Yahweh your Elohim. The blood of your sacrifices is to be poured out beside the altar of Yahweh your Elohim, but you may eat the meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sure you obey all these instructions I’m giving you. Then things will always go well for you and your descendants because you will be doing what Yahweh your Elohim considers good and right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim will destroy the nations where you’re going and force them out of your way. You will take possession of their land and live there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they’ve been destroyed, be careful you aren’t tempted to follow their customs. Don’t even ask about their gods and say, “How did these people worship their gods? We want to do what they did.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never worship Yahweh your Elohim in the way they worship their gods, because everything they do for their gods is disgusting to Yahweh. He hates it! They even burn their sons and daughters as sacrifices to their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sure to do everything I command you. Never add anything to it or take anything away from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of your people, claiming to be a prophet or to have prophetic dreams, may predict a miraculous sign or an amazing thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What he predicts may even take place. But don’t listen to that prophet or dreamer if he says, “Let’s worship and serve other gods.” (Those gods may be gods you’ve never heard of.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim is testing you to find out if you really love Yahweh your Elohim with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Worship Yahweh your Elohim, fear him, obey his commands, listen to what he says, serve him, and be loyal to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That prophet or dreamer must be put to death because he preached rebellion against Yahweh your Elohim, who brought you out of Egypt and freed you from slavery. He was trying to lead you away from following the directions Yahweh your Elohim gave you. You must get rid of this evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your own brother, son, or daughter, the wife you love, or your best friend may secretly tempt you, saying, “Let’s go worship other gods.” (Those gods may be gods that you and your ancestors never knew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They may be the gods of the people around you, who live near or far, from one end of the land to the other.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t be influenced by any of these people or listen to them. Have no pity on them. Don’t feel sorry for them or protect them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must put them to death. You must start the execution. Then all the other people will join you in putting them to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stone them to death because they were trying to lead you away from Yahweh your Elohim, who brought you out of slavery in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel will hear about it and be afraid. Then no one among you will ever do such a wicked thing again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may hear that the residents in one of the cities which Yahweh your Elohim is giving you to live in
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: have been led away from the Lord your God by worthless people. You may hear that these people have been saying, “Let’s worship other gods.” (Those gods may be gods you’ve never heard of.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then make a thorough investigation. If it is true, and you can prove that this disgusting thing has been done among you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must kill the residents of that city with swords and destroy that city and everyone in it, including the animals, because they are claimed by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gather their goods into the middle of the city square. Then burn their city and all their goods as a burnt offering to Yahweh your Elohim. It must remain a mound of ruins and never be rebuilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t ever take any of the things claimed for destruction. Then Yahweh will stop being angry and will show you mercy. In his mercy he will make your population increase, as he swore to your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim will do this if you listen to him, obey all the commands that I’m giving you today, and do what Yahweh your Elohim considers right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are the children of Yahweh your Elohim. So when someone dies, don’t mourn by cutting yourselves or shaving bald spots on your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are people who are holy to Yahweh your Elohim. Out of all the people who live on earth, Yahweh has chosen you to be his own special possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never eat anything that is disgusting to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here are the kinds of animals you may eat: oxen, sheep, goats,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: deer, gazelles, fallow deer, wild goats, mountain goats, antelope, and mountain sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat all animals that have completely divided hoofs and that also chew their cud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some animals chew their cud, while others have completely divided hoofs. You may not eat these kinds of animals. They include camels, rabbits, and rock badgers. (Although they chew their cud, they don’t have divided hoofs. They are unclean for you.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, you may not eat pigs. (Although their hoofs are divided, they don’t chew their cud.) Never eat their meat or touch their dead bodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here’s what you may eat of every creature that lives in the water: You may eat any creature that has fins and scales.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But never eat anything that doesn’t have fins and scales. It is unclean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat any clean bird.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But here are the birds that you should never eat: eagles, bearded vultures, black vultures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: buzzards, all types of kites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all types of crows,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ostriches, nighthawks, seagulls, all types of falcons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: little owls, great owls, barn owls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: pelicans, ospreys, cormorants,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: storks, all types of herons, hoopoes, and bats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every swarming, winged insect is also unclean for you. They must never be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, you may eat any other kind of flying creature that is clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Never eat any creature that dies naturally. You may give it to the foreigners who live in your cities, and they may eat it. You may also sell it to foreigners who are visiting. But you are people who are holy to Yahweh your Elohim.
Never cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every year be sure to save a tenth of the crops harvested from whatever you plant in your fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eat the tenth of your grain, new wine, and olive oil, and eat the firstborn of your cattle, sheep, and goats in the presence of Yahweh your Elohim in the place he will choose to put his name. Then you will learn to fear Yahweh your Elohim as long as you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the place Yahweh your Elohim will choose to put his name may be too far away. Yahweh your Elohim may bless you with so much that you can’t carry a tenth of your income that far.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If so, exchange the tenth part of your income for silver. Take the silver with you, and go to the place Yahweh your Elohim will choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Use the silver to buy whatever you want: cattle, sheep, goats, wine, liquor—whatever you choose. Then you and your family will eat and enjoy yourselves there in the presence of Yahweh your Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never forget to take care of the Levites who live in your cities. They have no land of their own as you have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of every third year bring a tenth of that year’s crop, and store it in your cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Foreigners, orphans, and widows who live in your cities may come to eat all they want. The Levites may also come because they have no land of their own as you have. Then Yahweh your Elohim will bless you in whatever work you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of every seven years, you must cancel debts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you will do: If you’ve made a loan, don’t collect payment on the debt your neighbor still owes you. Don’t demand that your neighbor or relative pay you, because the time for suspending payments on debts has been proclaimed in Yahweh’s honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may demand that a foreigner pay, but don’t collect payment on the debt another Israelite still owes you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In any case, there shouldn’t be any poor people among you, because Yahweh your Elohim will certainly bless you in the land he is giving you as your own possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will bless you only if you listen carefully to Yahweh your Elohim and faithfully obey all these commands I’m giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim will bless you, as he promised. You will make loans to many nations, but you will not have to borrow from any of them. You will rule many nations, but no nation will ever rule you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you must do whenever there are poor Israelites in one of your cities in the land that Yahweh your Elohim is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be generous to these poor people, and freely lend them as much as they need. Never be hard-hearted and tight-fisted with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the seventh year—the year when payments on debts are canceled—is near, you might be stingy toward poor Israelites and give them nothing. Be careful not to think these worthless thoughts. The poor will complain to Yahweh about you, and you will be condemned for your sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sure to give to them without any hesitation. When you do this, Yahweh your Elohim will bless you in everything you work for and set out to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will always be poor people in the land. That’s why I command you to be generous to other Israelites who are poor and needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever Hebrew men or women are sold to you as slaves, they will be your slaves for six years. In the seventh year you must let them go free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you let them go, don’t send them away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Generously give them provisions—sheep from your flocks, grain from your threshing floor, and wine from your winepress. Be as generous to them as Yahweh your Elohim has been to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt and Yahweh your Elohim freed you. That’s why I’m giving you this command today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But suppose a male slave says to you, “I don’t want to leave you,” because he loves you and your family and is happy with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then take an awl and pierce it through his ear lobe into a door, and he will be your slave for life. Do the same to a female slave if she doesn’t want to leave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have to let your slave go free, it won’t be a hardship for you. It would have cost you twice as much to hire someone to do the same work for those six years. Besides, Yahweh your Elohim will bless you in everything you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must dedicate every firstborn male from your herds and flocks to Yahweh your Elohim. Never use a firstborn ox for work, and never shear a firstborn sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every year you and your family must eat these animals in the presence of Yahweh your Elohim in the place Yahweh will choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if an animal is lame or blind or has any other serious defect—never sacrifice it to Yahweh your Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eat it in your city. Clean and unclean people may eat them together as if they were eating a gazelle or a deer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But never eat the blood. Pour it on the ground like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor Yahweh your Elohim by celebrating Passover in the month of Abib. In the month of Abib Yahweh your Elohim brought you out of Egypt at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator
